definition: to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street

sentences.english: The scribbles on the wall must be the work of those children.
sentences.chinese: 牆壁上的塗鴉準是那幾個孩子畫的。

sentences.english: As with all graffiti, the interpretation of the piece is left up to the viewer.
sentences.chinese: 對於所有的塗鴉來說，作品所演繹的概念在乎觀者。

sentences.english: The famous stairs are now covered with graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 這道著名的石階現在已被畫滿了塗鴉。

sentences.english: Anti-Australia graffiti is sprinkled around the capital, Dili.
sentences.chinese: 反對澳大利亞的塗鴉在首都帝力各處噴塗。

sentences.english: Wipe off these scribblings from the blackboard.
Every now and then Justin and Audrey also love to doodle on the glass doors with markers.
sentences.chinese: 平時有事沒事大小貝貝還拿彩色筆在玻璃上塗鴉。

sentences.english: Randomly paint the layer with a 200px soft brush with 60% opacity.
sentences.chinese: 用透明度60%，粗細200px的軟筆刷隨便塗鴉。

sentences.english: Offer your child thick crayons and paper to scribble on.
sentences.chinese: 提供些粗蠟筆及厚紙任孩子塗鴉。

sentences.english: Obviously a romantic doodle. Drawing a heart indicates you’re in love with love.
sentences.chinese: 顯然這是很浪漫的塗鴉，它暗示了你正被愛包圍。

sentences.english: V-neck sporty vest with a graffiti graphic print.
sentences.chinese: 領運動背心有塗鴉設計印花。

sentences.english: Thee expression on a doodled face is often a good indication of the mood or character of the person who has drawn it.
sentences.chinese: 塗鴉的面部表情通常透露出了作畫者的性格或心情。

sentences.english: This is obviously a burial ground for old Google doodles.
sentences.chinese: 這顯然是一箇舊的谷歌塗鴉的墓地。

sentences.english: Perhaps, pure canvas shoes and doodle.
sentences.chinese: 或者，潔白的帆布鞋和塗鴉。

sentences.english: The chances are you’ll start doodling.
sentences.chinese: 這是你開始塗鴉的絕好機會。

sentences.english: Head-on, from his position, the dust looked almost like a child’s doodle.
sentences.chinese: 他所看見的塵埃痕跡猶如小孩子的隨手塗鴉。

sentences.english: The program began as part of Philadelphia's Anti-Graffiti Network.
sentences.chinese: 該計劃本爲費城的反塗鴉組織的一部分。

definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
